# Matplotlib titles

We can add a title to our graphs, and labels to our x and y axis, so that anyone can see what our graphs are showing.

We can add a title with `plt.title()` and x and y axis labels with `plt.xlabel()` and `plt.ylabel()`. 

```{python}
# Import the plotting library from matplotlib 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Make a list of x values and y values
x = [3, 1, 2.5]
y = [7,4, 9]

# Plotting x values against y values 
plt.scatter(x, y, marker="*", s=200, color="darkorchid")

# Add a title 
plt.title("Example scatter graph")

# Label the x and y axis
plt.xlabel("This is the x axis")
plt.ylabel("This is the y axis")

# View the created graph
plt.show()
```
